intro: Oedera pungens subsp. trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined oedera, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having three prominent veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. Oedera pungens subsp. trinervis is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
